title: The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Markets
description: A quick win: understand The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Markets.

hook.text: 74% of fund managers believe they are above average at investing. Mathematically, half of them are wrong.

buildup.text: The Dunning-Kruger effect: people with low ability at a task overestimate their skill. Beginners feel most confident.

discovery.text: Novice traders trade more frequently and take bigger risks â€” because they don't know what they don't know.

twist.text: Studies show the more someone trades, the worse they perform. Overconfidence is the most expensive bias in finance.

climax.text: Markets don't reward confidence â€” they reward accuracy. The gap between the two is where fortunes are lost.

punchline.text: The less you know about markets, the more you think you know.

quiz.question: How does the Dunning-Kruger effect manifest in financial markets?
options: Novice investors overestimate their skill and trade too aggressively
